page.title: 17MARGARET BARCLAY SCHOOL
page.content: The Margaret Barclay Residential School for physically handicapped children was once a private house set in 14 acres of garden. The house was built in 1850 but in 1940 Sir Noton Barclay became the owner. During the war, Sir Noton, who had a physically handicapped daughter named Margaret, offered to accommodate handicapped children from Manchester. After Margaret died, Sir Noton gave the house to Manchester Education Committee to run as a physically handicapped school. The school has accommodation for 48 children drawn from the North West of England. There are 48 domestic and professional staff under the headmaster Mr. William Horsfall.The children stay at school up to the age of 17 or 18. At present the school is under threat of closure.
